Expansion of U.S. Military Base Rejected by S. Koreans
articles.content:
Expansion of U.S. Military Base Rejected by S. Koreans 
   Pyongyang, September 5 (KCNA) -- 77 south Korean public figures including the permanent executive chairman of the People's Solidarity, the co-representative of the Women's Society for Achieving Peace and the secretary general of the Green Federation reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on August 31 and made public a declaration against the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek.
 The declaration said the expansion of the U.S. military base can never be justified although the "government" asserted that it is a state policy passed through the parliament in the wake of an agreement between south Korea and the U.S.    
 Noting that the expansion of the U.S. military base has threatened peace in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia as well as the right to existence of residents in Phyongthaek as it is aimed to realize the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces in south Korea, the declaration urged the "government" to get rid of its pro-American position that the renegotiation for the transfer of the base is impossible.
